Fact.Description: Months lived with TP in US Options

Fact.Name: SSN Employment Validity Options
Fact.Description: Options for SSN Employment validity

Fact.Name: Residency duration Options
Fact.Description: Options for residency duration

Fact.Name: Family and Household
Fact.Description: The people entered in the family and household section who may qualify as QPs or dependents

Fact.Name: Dependents is Done
Fact.Description: The user has clicked "Done" for the family and HH section

Fact.Name: Has incomplete dependents
Fact.Description: One or more of the dependents entered is incomplete

Fact.Name: First name
Fact.Description: Do I exist? Used to detect stale collection references.

Fact.Name: First name
Fact.Description: The first name of the dependent. Must match the name as known to the Social Security Administration.

Fact.Name: Middle initial
Fact.Description: The middle initial of the dependent. Must match the name as known to the Social Security Administration. This is the optional writable fact. Please use derived fact in downstream calculations.

Fact.Name: Middle Initial
Fact.Description: The middle initial of the dependent. Must match the name as known to the Social Security Administration.

Fact.Name: Last name
Fact.Description: The last name of the dependent. Must match the name as known to the Social Security Administration.
The last name and suffix of the dependent
The suffix of the dependent.

Fact.Name: Suffix string
Fact.Description: The suffix of the dependent as a string for concatenation.
The suffix of the dependent. Exported for mef

Fact.Name: Dependent Has IP PIN
Fact.Description: Whether the dependent has an IP Pin

Fact.Name: Dependent IP Pin Ready
Fact.Description: Whether the TP is ready to input the IP PIN

Fact.Name: Dependent IP Pin
Fact.Description: The Identity PIN of the Dependent

Fact.Name: Dependent's full name
Fact.Description: The full name of the dependent, used for the frontend

Fact.Name: Dependent's full name
Fact.Description: The full name of the dependent

Fact.Name: TIN type
Fact.Description: The type of the dependent's TIN.

Fact.Name: TIN type long
Fact.Description: Alias for a dependent's TIN as a separate fact to specifically display the shortened (acronym) text.

Fact.Name: TIN type long
Fact.Description: The type of the dependent's TIN as a separate fact to display the full text.

Fact.Name: TIN type is none
Fact.Description: Whether the type of the dependent's TIN is none.

Fact.Name: TIN
Fact.Description: The taxpayer identification number of the family or household member. Collected only if the TP is claiming the dependent or claiming them as a qualifying person for a credit. Do *not* ever use `/tin/isSSN` the way we might for filers, because we haven't necessarily collected the tin at the times we need that test. Instead, check the tinType.

Fact.Name: Dependent has TIN
Fact.Description: Dependent has provided a TIN

Fact.Name: Dependents with TINs
Fact.Description: All dependents who have provided TINs

Fact.Name: Dependent TIN is unique
Fact.Description: Is this dependent's TIN unique among dependents and filers?

Fact.Name: Dependent's SSN is invalid
Fact.Description: Checks whether dependent is declared to have an SSN, but the TIN is not a valid SSN

Fact.Name: Dependent's ITIN is invalid
Fact.Description: Checks whether dependent is declared to have an ITIN, but the TIN is not a valid ITIN

Fact.Name: Dependent's ATIN is invalid
Fact.Description: Checks whether dependent is declared to have an ATIN, but the TIN is not a valid ATIN

Fact.Name: At least one dependent has an invalid TIN
Fact.Description: Whether at least one dependent's TIN does not match the format for the type of TIN they were declared to have

Fact.Name: Date of birth
Fact.Description: The date of birth of the dependent.

Fact.Name: Year of birth
Fact.Description: The year of the dependent's birth
The year of the dependent's birth is the same as the tax year
Date dependent was born if born in the tax year

Fact.Name: Deceased
Fact.Description: Whether the dependent died during the tax year
Date dependent died if died in the tax year

Fact.Name: Deceased Code
Fact.Description: The MeF code to be set when the dependent is both deceased and does not have a TIN.

The person was born and died in the tax year, and never received a TIN. This person is not supported by direct file.
In future years, we will have to submit binary attachments along with this person and set the DiedLiteralCd in MeF
The family/household member who caused the born and died in TY knockout
We should knockout the user because one of their family and household was born and died in the tax year without a TIN.

Fact.Name: Not Deceased
Fact.Description: Whether the dependent did not die during the tax year

Fact.Name: Date of death
Fact.Description: The date on which the person died

Fact.Name: Age
Fact.Description: The age of the dependent at the end of the tax year.
Whether the dependent is older than 18 and under 24 at the end of the year. In the future, when we support more tax credits, we may want to ask this of everyone.

Disability status is used to qualify someone as a dependent, passing the age test. E.g. Even if a person is 99 years old, they can still pass the age test to be a qualifying child.
A disabled person may also be eligible to be claimed for a benefit split. Therefore we need to ask about disability status whenever: 1. The person is 18.5 or older, so they may be eligible for the benefit split due to disability 2. The person is not 18.5, but they are younger than the filer (or spouse if MFJ)
The person has been claimed if they are claimable, or the TP is eligible to use them for benefits based on a benefit split
A non-dependent who qualifies for CDCC
A child for whom the parent cannot be listed as care provider. If a child is biological, adopted, or a foster child, and under 13 years old, then they cannot have a parent listed as care provider.
A non-dependent who qualifies for CDCC and/or EITC. Used to determine showing tin/pin info in Family and HH.

The set of non-dependent people, added in the family + HH section, who may qualify for the Child and Dependent Care Credit for whom we may still need to collect a TIN (or PIN if provided). They did indicate in the Family and Household subsection that they have a tin (assigned by the government). This is used to determine whether to collect a TIN and PIN later in the application if needed.
The set of non-dependent people, added in the family + HH section, who qualify for the Child and Dependent Care Credit for whom we have collected a TIN (or PIN if provided).
There is at least one CDCC nondependent qualifying person for whom we have collected a TIN (or PIN if provided). Used for conditionally showing content.
The set of non-dependent people, added in the family + HH section, who qualify for the Child and Dependent Care Credit for whom we have not yet collected a TIN (or PIN if provided).
Whether there are no TINs (or IP PINs if needed) to collect for non-dependent people who qualify for the Child and Dependent Care Credit.
TP has only one CDCC non-dependent qualifying person who was assigned a tin.
Whether or not this person could qualify the taxpayer for the CDCC. Pending the taxpayer electing to claim then as a dependent.
This person qualifies the taxpayer for CDCC
The set of people, added in the family + HH section, who may qualify for the Child and Dependent Care Credit.
Count of Qualifying Persons for CDCC that are not filers
The person was physically or mentally unable to care for themselves
Household member is over age 12 and unable to care for themselves. Used for CDCC qualification, pdf, and mef.
We have collected expenses for CDCC if required. Used to test completion of the CDCC QP loop.

Fact.Name: Qualifying Expense Amount for CDCC
Fact.Description: Amount of qualifying expenses paid for this qualifying person. Only applies if the person is a CDCC QP

Fact.Name: Qualifying Expense Amount for CDCC
Fact.Description: Amount of qualifying expenses paid for this qualifying person. Only applies if the person is a CDCC QP
Whether the QP has qualifying dependent care expenses
Whether the QP's expenses were paid to a qualified provider
Whether the dependent had expenses that were qualifying and paid to a qualified provider

Fact.Name: Under Age 19
Fact.Description: Whether or not the dependent is under the age of 19
Whether the dependent was born on January 1st of the tax year.
The age of the dependent on January 1st of the tax year, assuming if born on that day their age is incremented on that day
Whether the dependent turned 13 after Jan 1st in the tax year as required for CDCC conditions
The collection of cdcc qualified people who turned thirteen after January 1 of the tax year

The collection of cdcc qualified people who turned thirteen after January 1 of the tax year who were not unable to care for themselves. Used to determine conditional content for what expenses to exclude.

The collection of cdcc-qualified qualifying children who turned thirteen after January 1 of the tax year who were unable to care for themselves. Used to determine conditional content for what expenses to exclude.
The HH member was unable to care for themselves and was not qualifying child under age 13. Used to determine conditional content for what expenses to include.

The collection of CDCC qualified people who were unable to care for themselves and were not qualifying children under age 13. This collection also does not include Qcs who turned 13 in the tax year. Used to determine conditional content for what expenses to include.
The age of the dependent for the majority of the year, i.e. their age on July 2. Note that July 2 works regardless of whether it is a leap year or not.

Fact.Name: Younger than eighteen at end of year
Fact.Description: Whether the dependent is younger than 18 at the end of the year.

Fact.Name: Flow show parent help text
Fact.Description: Whether to show parent help text in the flow
Whether a dependent is at least one of: foster or adopted child of TP

Fact.Name: Is claimed child living with taxpayer
Fact.Description: Is the dependent considered a child living with and claimed by the taxpayer? Used in the 1040 XML.

Fact.Name: Is claimed other dependent
Fact.Description: Is the dependent considered an other dependent and claimed by the taxpayer? Used in the 1040 XML.

Fact.Name: Claimed child who lived with you count
Fact.Description: A count of the child who lived with and are claimed by the taxpayer. Used in the 1040 XML.

Fact.Name: Claimed other dependents listed count
Fact.Description: A count of the other dependents claimed by the taxpayer. Used in the 1040 XML.

Fact.Name: Full-time student
Fact.Description: Is the dependent a full-time student?

Fact.Name: Permanent and total disability
Fact.Description: Is the dependent permanently and totally disabled? We intentionally do not AND this with "../disabilityStatusMayAffectBenefits" in our MeF export, as that would mark people as "not disabled" when the app simply did not ask them about their disability status.

Fact.Name: Age test
Fact.Description: Does the dependent pass the Age test to be a qualifying child?

Fact.Name: Residency duration
Fact.Description: What portion of the year did the dependent live with you?

Fact.Name: Residency test
Fact.Description: Did the dependent live with you for more than half the year? Used for dependents other than QSS.

Fact.Name: Residency test
Fact.Description: Did the dependent live with you for the whole year? This is the rule for QSS Persons. See https://www.irs.gov/publications/p501

Fact.Name: Need to show screen AddPersonKeepingUpHome
Fact.Description:
Flow variable for screen AddPersonKeepingUpHome.
We only show this when * the TP is trying to qualify for HoH and QSS, and the person is still eligible as HohQualifyingPerson or QSSQualifyingPerson * OR the filer is MFS, could potentially be considered unmarried for the purposes of Form 2441, and this person could be a qualifying person

Fact.Name: Need to show screen AddPersonKeepingUpParentsHome
Fact.Description: Flow variable for screen AddPersonKeepingUpParentsHome

Fact.Name: Need to show screen AddPersonSsnValidForWork
Fact.Description: We only ask this question if the dependent is still on track for being either a qualfiying child for CTC or a qualifying child for EITC

Fact.Name: Married
Fact.Description: Is the dependent married?

Fact.Name: Filing a joint return
Fact.Description: Are the dependent and their spouse filing a joint return?

Fact.Name: Filing a joint return
Fact.Description: Are the dependent and their spouse filing a joint return?
Are the dependent and their spouse required to file?
Are the dependent and their spouse required to file?

Fact.Name: Filing only for refund
Fact.Description: Are the dependent and their spousefiling a return only to claim a refund of income tax withheld or estimated tax paid?

Fact.Name: Filing only for refund
Fact.Description: Are the dependent and their spousefiling a return only to claim a refund of income tax withheld or estimated tax paid?

Fact.Name: Joint Return test
Fact.Description: Does the dependent pass the Joint Return test to be a qualifying child?

Fact.Name: Flow should show QC support test.
Fact.Description: Used by the flow to decide whether to show screens to run the support test for the qualifying child. Comes before the joint return test.

Fact.Name: Qualifying child
Fact.Description: Does the dependent pass all five qualifying child tests?

Fact.Name: EITC relationship age residency and joint return test
Fact.Description: Determines whether a dependent passes the relationship, age, residency and joint return test

Fact.Name: At least one child can be QC of another
Fact.Description: At least one child can be the qualifying child of another

Fact.Name: At least one child is disqualified because of relationship age residency or joint return test
Fact.Description: Whether at least one child is disqualified because of relationship, age, residency, or joint return test for EITC
The family member can be a QP for EITC, and the TP is eligible to receive EITC
The household member can be a QP for CDCC, and the TP is eligible to receive CDCC
The household member can be a QP for HoH, and the TP is eligible to have a filing status of HoH
The TP can be a QP for QSS, and the TP is eligible to have a filing status of QSS

Fact.Name: EITC Qualifying child
Fact.Description:
Does the child qualify as a QC for EITC? This is mostly the same as the QC test, but omits the support test and has a different residency test.
TODO: take into account QC of another

The child both qualifies the TP for EITC, and qualifies to increase the amount of EITC they will receive.
EITC qualifying children use different paths for eligibility and calculation. A child may make a taxpayer eligible for the credit, but if they don't have an SSN, they will not increase the amount of the credit.

Fact.Name: EITC Eligible Dependents Collection For Calculation
Fact.Description: The subset of people who qualify as qualifying children for EITC

Fact.Name: Qualified EIC Dependents
Fact.Description: The qualified people to list on Schedule EIC
The potential schedule EIC dependents, but only if we're actually receiving EITC

Fact.Name: Schedule EIC Dependents
Fact.Description: The people to list on Schedule EIC

Fact.Name: Flow variable for qualifying child of another
Fact.Description: Whether to display the qualifying child of another subsubsection
Whether we need to see if the person is a QC of another to make a determination

Fact.Name: Qualifying child of another taxpayer
Fact.Description: (writable) Is the dependent the qualifying child of any other taxpayer?
Is the dependent the qualifying child of any other taxpayer?
The dependent is not our qualifying child, but could be someone else's.
Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent could be a qualifying child) required to file a return?
Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent could be a qualifying child) required to file a return?
Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent could be a qualifying child) filing a return?
Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent could be a qualifying child) filing a return?

Fact.Name: Other taxpayer is filing
Fact.Description: Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent is a qualifying child) filing solely for refund of income tax withheld or estimated tax paid?

Fact.Name: Other taxpayer is filing
Fact.Description: Is the other taxpayer (for whom the dependent is a qualifying child) filing solely for refund of income tax withheld or estimated tax paid?
The dependent would have been a qc of another but they are not filing, or not filing for credits/dependents

Whether the dependent is the qualifying child of another taxpayer. This includes tests that they can be the qualifying child of another taxpayer, and makes sure that that they count as a QC of another taxpayer due to how that taxpayer is filing.

Fact.Name: Taxpayer claims dependent
Fact.Description: Whether the taxpayer wants to claim the dependent.

Fact.Name: Not qualifying child test
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the not qualifying child test for purposes of determining qualifying relative.

Fact.Name: Lived with you all year
Fact.Description: Did the dependent live with you all year as a member of your household?

Fact.Name: Relationship or member of household test
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the relationship/member of household test for purposes of determining qualifying relative.

Fact.Name: Gross income limit
Fact.Description: The gross income limit for purposes of the qualifying relative gross income test referenced in 152(d)(1)(B). Rev Proc .24 Gross Income Limitation for a Qualifying Relative 152(d)(1)(B)

Fact.Name: Gross income test
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the gross income test for purposes of determining qualifying relative (their gross income was less than /grossIncomeLimit).

Fact.Name: Own support
Fact.Description: Did the dependent provide more than half their own support?

Fact.Name: Support test
Fact.Description: Does the dependent pass the Support test to be a qualifying child?

Fact.Name: Support test (for qualifying relative)
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the support test for purposes of determining qualifying relative (you provided more than half their support).

Fact.Name: Support test (for qualifying relative)
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the support test for purposes of determining qualifying relative (you provided more than half their support).

Fact.Name: Qualifying relative
Fact.Description: Does the dependent pass all four qualifying relative tests?
Does the dependent pass the three tests that precede QC of another

Fact.Name: Resident of the U.S.
Fact.Description: The dependent resides in the United States of America.

Fact.Name: Dependent is U.S. National
Fact.Description: The dependent is not a citizen, but is a U.S. national.

Fact.Name: Resident of Canada or Mexico
Fact.Description: The dependent resides in Canada or Mexico.

Fact.Name: Citizenship for dependent
Fact.Description: Whether the filer was a U.S. citizen for part of the tax year

Fact.Name: Resident of the U.S.
Fact.Description: The dependent resides in the United States of America.

Fact.Name: Dependent is U.S. National
Fact.Description: The dependent is not a citizen, but is a U.S. national.

Fact.Name: Resident of Canada or Mexico
Fact.Description: The dependent resides in Canada or Mexico and is not a U.S. citizen, resident, or national.

Fact.Name: Citizen or resident test
Fact.Description: The dependent passes the Citizen or Resident Test for purposes of claiming as a dependent.

Fact.Name: May not have lived with Taxpayer in U.S. for entire tax year test
Fact.Description: The dependent might not have been living with the taxpayer in the U.S. for the entire tax year. Either they were born or died during the tax year, are adopted or a foster child, or could have been kidnapped.
Is the person an adopted child?

Fact.Name: Adopted child exception to the citizen or resident test
Fact.Description: If the taxpayer is a U.S. citizen or U.S. national and legally adopts a child who isn't a U.S. citizen, U.S. resident alien, or U.S. national, then that child can pass the dependent residency test if they lived with the taxpayer all year as a member of the household. This exception also applies if the child was lawfully placed with the taxpayer for legal adoption and the child lived with the taxpayer for the rest of the year after placement (even if it wasn't all year).

Fact.Name: Citizen or U.S. resident test
Fact.Description: A narrower Citizen or Resident Test for purposes of CTC and ODC, excluding residents of Canada and Mexico who are not U.S. nationals.
The person is an eligible dependent, but that's without taking into account whether the filer is eligible to claim dependents

Fact.Name: Eligible to be claimed as dependent
Fact.Description:
The person is eligible to be claimed as a dependent.
TODO: This does not account for qualifying child tiebreakers TODO: This does not account for MSAs, divorced/separated, etc.
The person is a Qualifying Child or a Qualifying Relative

Fact.Name: Is claimed dependent
Fact.Description: Whether the person is both allowed to be claimed as a dependent, and has been claimed as a dependent. Exists as a derived fact to ensure that an edit that disqualifies a person as a dependent causes them to no longer count as a dependent.

Fact.Name: Is not claimed dependent
Fact.Description: The negation of is claimed dependent
At some point, we gave the TP the chance to claim this dependent, but right now they're not eligible anymore
At some point, we gave the TP the chance to claim this dependent, but currently at least one of those dependents is no longer eligible to be claimed
The filer was at some point eligible to claim one or more dependents, and did so, but has since said they themselves are a dependent and so cannot have dependents of their own
The filer was at some point eligible to claim one or more dependents, and did so, but has since said they themselves are a dependent and so cannot have dependents of their own
At some point, we gave the TP the chance to claim this dependent (and so were complete up to that point), but now the dependent isn't complete and we haven't ruled them out as eligible
At some point, we gave the TP the chance to claim a dependent, but currently at least one of those dependents has become incomplete

Fact.Name: Is Completed Dependent
Fact.Description: Whether the TP has finished filling out the dependent section for this dependent. Right now, we're assuming that we should always complete whether a person is eligible to be a dependent and has been claimed. When we come back to revisit the dependents section post-GC, we may want to expand this condition to other qualifiers (e.g. HohQualifyingPerson)

Fact.Name: Is incomplete
Fact.Description: The opposite of isCompleted

Fact.Name: Qualifying person for Head of Household
Fact.Description: The person can qualify you for Head of Household filing status.

Per the decision record https://git.irslabs.org/irslabs-prototypes/direct-file/-/wikis/Decision-log/Your-dependents,-qualifying-persons/Must-claim-dependent-on-return a claimable dependent must be claimed to act as a QP in TY2023
This fact tests if the person is either claimed, or not claimable. This is necessary to be a QP for HOH, QSS, EITC, or CDCC.

Fact.Name: Qualifying person for Qualified Surviving Spouse
Fact.Description: The person can qualify you for Qualified Surviving Spouse filing status.

Fact.Name: Need to show AddPersonLivedWithTpInUs screen
Fact.Description: Flow variable for AddPersonLivedWithTpInUs screen. We only ask if we're still trying to validate if the person may qualify as a QC for EITC. So we ask if: 1. The filers are eligible for EITC 2. The person already passes the age test and relationship test for EITC QC 3. They've lived with the TP most of the year

Fact.Name: Lived with taxpayer in U.S. most of the year
Fact.Description:
Did the dependent live with the taxpayer in the U.S for most of the year?
Note that "six" corresponds with the text "more than 6 months but less than 7 months." When reported on schedule EIC, this will be rounded up to a "7."
How many months did the person live with the TP in the US?
How many days did the person live with the TP in the US?

Fact.Name: Taxpayer paid most of home upkeep
Fact.Description: Did taxpayer pay more than half the cost of keeping up the home shared with the dependent?

Fact.Name: Taxpayer paid most of parent's home upkeep
Fact.Description: Did taxpayer pay more than half the cost of keeping up their dependent parent's main home?

Fact.Name: Employment validity
Fact.Description: Employment validity statements printed on dependent's Social Security card.

Fact.Name: Has an SSN valid for employment
Fact.Description: The dependent has a Social Security Number that is not marked "Not Valid For Employment", or that requires work authorization but that authorization is no longer valid.
The dependent received their social security number solely to apply for a federally funded benefit, like Medicaid.
The SSN is marked "not valid" for employment

Fact.Name: Has an SSN valid for employemnt
Fact.Description: The dependent has a Social Security Number that is not marked "Not Valid For Employment", or that requires work authorization but that authorization is no longer valid.

Fact.Name: Eligible for the Child Tax Credit
Fact.Description: The dependent is eligible for the Child Tax Credit (CTC).

Fact.Name: Claimed for the Child Tax Credit Dependent
Fact.Description: The dependent is claimed for the Child Tax Credit (CTC).

Fact.Name: Eligible for the Credit for Other Dependents
Fact.Description: The dependent is eligible for the Credit for Other Dependents (ODC).

Fact.Name: Claimed for the Credit for Other Dependents
Fact.Description: The dependent is claimed for the Credit for Other Dependents (ODC).

Fact.Name: Is Claimed
Fact.Description: The dependent's claimed status
Household member may qualify TP for one of the benefits, but not certain unless filing status is known
Household member qualifies TP for at least one benefit since we know filing status
At least one of the benefits a household member qualifies for is not yet complete

Fact.Name: Qualifies for filing status(es)
Fact.Description: Whether a dependent qualifies the TP for filing status(es), leverages TP's info

Fact.Name: Qualifies for tax credit(s)
Fact.Description: Whether a dependent qualifies the TP for tax credit(s), leverages TP's info. This requires the income section to be complete
The dependent is an EITC QC who is unclaimed and who has a TIN
The dependent is an EITC QC who is unclaimed and who we need a TIN for

Fact.Name: Qualifying Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: A collection of all the dependents that could be claimed

Fact.Name: Unclaimed EITC QCs
Fact.Description: A collection of people to be claimed as EITC QCs who have not been claimed as dependents
A collection of people to be claimed as EITC QCs who have not been claimed as dependents that have TINs (that we might need to collect)
How many unclaimed EITC QCs are are talking about
Does the filer have more than zero EITC QC?
Does the filer have more than one EITC QC?

Fact.Name: Dependents who don't qualify for any benefits
Fact.Description: A collection of dependents who don't qualify for any benefits

Fact.Name: Dependents who don't qualify for any benefits
Fact.Description: A collection of dependents who don't qualify for any benefits

Fact.Name: At least one dependent who doesn't qualify for any benefits
Fact.Description: Checks whether there is at least one dependent that doesn't qualify for any benefits

Fact.Name: Claimed Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of claimable dependents that actually are claimed

Fact.Name: CTC Eligible Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of claimed dependents who qualify for CTC
The count of subset of claimed dependents who qualify for CTC is greater than one

Fact.Name: CTC Eligible Dependents when form 8862 is required for CTC Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of dependents who are claimed for CTC when the TP is required to use form 8862 for CTC

Fact.Name: EITC Eligible Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of people who qualify as qualifying children for EITC

Fact.Name: EITC Eligible Dependents for form 8862 Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of people who qualify as qualifying children for EITC when form 8862 is required, for PDF

Fact.Name: ODC Eligible Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of claimed dependents who qualify for ODC

Fact.Name: Whether the ODC Eligible Dependents Collection has a count greater than one
Fact.Description: The subset of claimed dependents who qualify for ODC

Fact.Name: ODC Eligible Dependents when form 8862 is required for ODC Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of dependents that are claimed for ODC when form 8862 is required for ODC

Fact.Name: Unclaimed Dependents Collection
Fact.Description: The subset of people the TP has entered who have not been claimed as dependents

Fact.Name: DeceasedEitcEligibleQcCollection
Fact.Description: The collection of EITC eligible QCs who died during the tax year. Required for form 8862, if the TP has to file form 8862.

Fact.Name: Claiming More Than 1 Dependents
Fact.Description: Are you claiming more than 1 dependents
The filer has unclaimed EITC QCs for whom we still need to collect TINs
The filer has unclaimed EITC QCs and qualifies for EITC overall

Fact.Name: Has Unclaimed People
Fact.Description: Are there family or household members who have not been claimed as dependents?

Fact.Name: First Qualifying Dependent
Fact.Description: The first qualifying dependent

Fact.Name: Claiming More Than 4 Dependents
Fact.Description: Are you claiming more than 4 dependents

Fact.Description: Are you claiming more than 4 dependents for CTC/RCTC/ACTC; for gating additional ctc dependents page for pdf form 8862

Fact.Name: Claiming More Than 4 ODC Dependents
Fact.Description: Are you claiming more than 4 dependents for ODC; for gating additional ODC dependents page for pdf form 8862

Fact.Name: Dependent is missing their IP Pin

Fact.Description: The filer says they have an IP Pin, they know it, and they've given it to us

Fact.Name: One or more dependents are missing IP Pin
Number of EITC Qualifying Children
Fact.Description: The number of dependents who qualify as QCs for EITC.

Fact.Name: Claimed Dependents Count
Fact.Description: The number of claimed dependents
Allows the student person to pass the age test as a student. The same age test applies to QC for dependents and EITC.

Fact.Name: Schedule EIC Line 4a Yes checkbox
Fact.Description: Whether to mark the PDF checkbox for this EIC qualifying child.

Fact.Name: Schedule EIC Line 4a No checkbox
Fact.Description: Whether to mark the PDF checkbox for this EIC qualifying child.

Fact.Name: Schedule EIC Line 4b Yes checkbox
Fact.Description: Whether to mark the PDF checkbox for this EIC qualifying child.
The taxpayer has not entered people in their family and HH section

Fact.Name: QSS Qualifying Dependent Collection
Fact.Description: A collection of all dependents that are QSS qualifying irrespective of claim status

Fact.Name: QSS Qualifying Dependent Unclaimed Collection
Fact.Description: A collection of all dependents that are QSS qualifying and not claimed

Fact.Name: QSS Qualifying Claimed Dependent Count
Fact.Description: A count of all of the QSS qualifying dependents that are claimed

Fact.Name: Has QSS Qualifying Unclaimed Dependent
Fact.Description: Boolean check for whether there are any unclaimed QSS qualifying dependents

Fact.Name: First QSS Qualifying Unclaimed Dependent
Fact.Description: We need a name for the QualifyingPersonName field, and this is the intermediate step

Fact.Name: First QSS Qualifying Unclaimed Dependent First Name
Fact.Description: First name of the QSS qualifying unclaimed dependent

Fact.Name: First QSS Qualifying Unclaimed Dependent Last Name
Fact.Description: Last name of the QSS qualifying unclaimed dependent

Fact.Name: Filer has a hoh qualifying parent
Fact.Description: This determines whether the filer's hoh qualifying person is a parent
The set of people who qualify the TP for HoH
If the TP is HoH, this is the person that they've chosen to allow them to claim HoH status.
Did you delete your HoH qualifying person?
The filer selected a dependent who, at the time, was an hohQualifyingPerson, but something changed and now they are not

Fact.Name: Is Biological, Adopted, Foster, or Stepchild
